title: Earlier delays on two Metro rail lines
text:
WASHINGTON, DC - NOVEMBER 29: Passengers wait for trains along the Red Line at the Cleveland Park station November 29, 2018 in Washington, DC. (Katherine Frey/The Washington Post)

Updated at 7:42 a.m.

Metro said trains are no longer sharing a track on the Yellow and Green lines. But the transit agency warned on Twitter that some delays may remain.

UPDATED: Yellow/Green Line Delay: No longer single tracking. Residual delays continue in both directions due to an earlier train malfunction at PG Plaza. — Metrorail Info (@Metrorailinfo) September 23, 2019

Original post at 7:15 a.m.

Riders on two Metro rail lines should expect delays Monday morning.

Trains are sharing a track between the College Park and Prince George’s Plaza stop. There’s a broken-down train at the Prince George’s Plaza stop.

It’s not clear how long the delays will last, but they’re in both directions of the line.
description: Trains on Metro's Yellow and Green lines are sharing a track.
